```{r}
# load libraries for data manipulation
library(tidyverse)

# search for data
library(osmdata)
```


```{r}
location <- "Rome"
getbb(location)
```
```{r}
available_features()
```


```{r}
feature <- "bicycle_road"
available_tags(feature)
```


```{r}
# bicycle_road points
br <- opq(c(12.23447,41.65564,12.85576,42.14103)) %>% 
  add_osm_feature(key = "bicycle_road") %>%
  osmdata_sf(quiet = FALSE)
```

```{r}
xmin <- sf::st_bbox(br$osm_points)[1]
ymin <- sf::st_bbox(br$osm_points)[2]
xmax <- sf::st_bbox(br$osm_points)[3]
ymax <- sf::st_bbox(br$osm_points)[4]
```

```{r}
# saveRDS(br, file = "data/br.RDS")
br <- readRDS("data/br.RDS")
```


```{r}
streets <- opq(c(12.23447,41.65564,12.85576,42.14103)) %>% 
  add_osm_feature(key = "highway", 
                  value = c("motorway", "primary", 
                            "secondary", "tertiary")) %>%
  osmdata_sf()
```


```{r}
saveRDS(streets, file = "data/streets.RDS")
streets <- readRDS("data/streets.RDS")
```


```{r}
small_streets <- opq(c(xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax)) %>% 
  add_osm_feature(key = "highway", 
                  value = c("residential", "living_street",
                            "unclassified",
                            "service", "footway")) %>%
  osmdata_sf()
```



```{r}
river <- opq(c(xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax)) %>%
  add_osm_feature(key = "waterway", value = "river") %>%
  osmdata_sf()
```



Make the map

The latitude of Rome, Italy is 41.902782, and the longitude is 12.496366.

```{r}
ggplot() +
 geom_sf(data = streets$osm_lines,
         inherit.aes = FALSE,
         color = "navy",
         linewidth = .5,
         alpha = .8) +
 geom_sf(data = small_streets$osm_lines,
         inherit.aes = FALSE,
         color = "grey20",
         linewidth = .1,
         alpha = .8) +
  geom_sf(data = br$osm_points,
          inherit.aes = FALSE,
          color = "red",
          size = 1,
          alpha = .8) +
    geom_sf(data = br$osm_points,
          inherit.aes = FALSE,
          color = "grey20",
          shape=21,
          stroke=0.1,
          size = 1.2,
          alpha = .9) +
  coord_sf(xlim=c(xmin,xmax),
         ylim=c(ymin,ymax),
           expand = FALSE) +
  theme_void()+
  theme(text=element_text(family="Gideon Roman"),
        plot.background = element_rect(fill="white",linewidth=0.5),
        panel.background = element_rect(fill="#dbd3c5",linewidth=1),
        plot.margin = margin(10,10,40,10,unit = "pt"))
```

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(sf)
library(cowplot)

# Main Map: Detailed View
main_map <- ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data = streets$osm_lines,
          inherit.aes = FALSE,
          color = "navy",
          linewidth = .5,
          alpha = .8) +
  geom_sf(data = small_streets$osm_lines,
          inherit.aes = FALSE,
          color = "grey20",
          linewidth = .1,
          alpha = .8) +
  geom_sf(data = br$osm_points,
          inherit.aes = FALSE,
          color = "red",
          size = 1,
          alpha = .8) +
  geom_sf(data = br$osm_points,
          inherit.aes = FALSE,
          color = "grey20",
          shape = 21,
          stroke = 0.1,
          size = 1.2,
          alpha = .9) +
  coord_sf(xlim = c(xmin, xmax),
           ylim = c(ymin, ymax),
           expand = FALSE) +
  theme_void() +
  theme(
    text = element_text(family = "Gideon Roman"),
    plot.background = element_rect(fill = "white", linewidth = 0.5),
    panel.background = element_rect(fill = "#dbd3c5", linewidth = 1),
    plot.margin = margin(10, 10, 40, 10, unit = "pt")
  )

# Inset Map: Overview of the Region
inset_map <- ggplot() +
 geom_sf(data = streets$osm_lines,
         inherit.aes = FALSE,
         color = "navy",
         linewidth = .07,
         alpha = .8) +
 geom_sf(data = small_streets$osm_lines,
         inherit.aes = FALSE,
         color = "grey20",
         linewidth = .1,
         alpha = .8) +
  geom_sf(data = br$osm_points,
          inherit.aes = FALSE,
          color = "red",
          size = 1,
          alpha = .8) +
  labs(caption="Rome")+
  theme_void() +
  theme(text = element_text(family = "Gideon Roman"),
        panel.background = element_rect(fill = alpha("white",alpha = 0.1),
                                        linewidth = 0),
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = alpha("white",alpha = 0.1),
                                       linewidth = 0))

# Combine Main Map with Inset Map
combined_map <- ggdraw() +
  draw_plot(main_map) +
  draw_plot(inset_map, x = 0.7, y = 0.7, width = 0.25, height = 0.25)  +
  draw_label("Bike Roads in Rome",
             x=0.5,y=0.19,
             size=14.5,
             fontface = "bold",
             fontfamily = "Gideon Roman")

combined_map
```
